info.meta: An introduction to automated solutions for &sap; administrators to efficiently configure &ha; and &sap; systems.

abstract.para: This article offers some automation solutions for &sap; administrators. With &salt; formulas, it helps to efficiently configure &ha; and &sap; systems. The solutions that is described here works from &slsreg; 12 SP3 and beyond. All packages are available in the &productnameshort; module.

note.title: About official &suse; support
note.para: The referenced &salt; formulas install and configure SAP software (&hana;, &netweaver;, and &s4h;) on &productname; including advanced configurations like &hana; System Replication setup and configure the &ha; cluster. The &salt; formulas are part of &sles4sapreg;, provided via the official repositories and are fully supported by &suse;.

&suse; works in the overall project on additional parts that cover infrastructure aspects (like machines, network, disk formats, mount points) that need to be performed with &suma;, &ay;, or Terraform and are not shipped as part of &productname;. These parts of the project available via &suse; GitHub repositories are published as-is and supported by the open source community. For more information, see .

sect1.title: Conceptual overview
sect1.para: Starting from the idea of modernizing and simplifying &hana; and &nw; deployments, &suse; engineering worked on rewriting the deployment wizards in &salt;. &salt; is a configuration management system that is also supported by &susemgr; and &slsreg; for any sort of automation.
The major motivation was to improve and simplify the installation of &hana; on &sls;.

The following sections contain a brief overview of available formulas. Each section contains also a link to the upstream GitHub project. There you can find additional documentation on how to use and apply the formulas.

sect1.title: Terminology
sect1.remark: toms 2020-06-23: add more terms and further explanations?

listitem.para: A scripting language. It interacts with lower-layer utilities such as &crmshell; and several &sap; commands, including &hana; management tools.

A configuration infrastructure management system written in Python. Due to its modular approach, it is often referred as &saltstack;.
&salt; has as a client/server architecture. The server (also called the &saltmaster;) acts as a central control unit for the clients (minions). The other supported setup option is called masterless.

Static data about &salt; minions. Grains contain information about the operating system that is running, the CPU architecture in use, and much more. Grains can also be set to assign values to minions.
Formulas are pre-written &salt; States.
For more information about &salt;, refer to the upstream documentation at .

Manages the infrastructure and the minions within it. It can execute commands remotely on minions and manage their state. The &saltmaster; captures grains sent from minions and decide what to do with this information.
A server or machine often controlled by the &saltmaster;. Its main purpose is to execute commands sent from the &saltmaster;, report data back, and send information about itself.
YAML text file to maintain consistency across your environment. &salt; states can be executed.
An infrastructure as code software tool. It deploys the required infrastructure in cloud or virtual environments and &ay; for on-premises deployments.

sect1.title: &hana; automated deployment
sect1.para: Use the &salt; formula saphanabootstrap-formula for bootstrapping and managing &hana; platform and system replication.
The &salt; formula takes care of the following

listitem.para: Installs &hana;.
Configures system replication.
Preconfigures the &ha; cluster requirements.
Configures the &hana; Prometheus exporter

sect1.para: The &salt; formula can be used in these scenarios:

listitem.para: &hana; single instance automated deployment.
Two &hana; instances on system replication setup.
Two &hana; instances on system replication and cluster scale-up performance-optimized configuration.
Two &hana; instances on system replication setup, cluster scale-up cost-optimized configuration, and extra &hana; installation on a secondary host.
Cloud Service Provides (Azure, AWS, and GCP) automated adjustments for each provider as best-practice.

sect1.title: &nw; automated configuration
sect1.para: Use the &salt; formula sapnwbootstrap-formula for bootstrapping and managing the &netweaver; platform.

note.para: The formula works only with &hana; as database.

listitem.para: ASCS instance
ERS instance
PAS instance
AAS instance
Database instance (this adds the required users, tables, views, etc. to the current Hana database)

Enqueue replication server version 2

sect1.title: &ha; cluster automated configuration
sect1.para: Use the &salt; formula habootstrap-formula for bootstrapping and managing a high availability cluster with the &crmshell;.

listitem.para: Creates and configures the &ha; cluster (Pacemaker, Corosync, SBD, and resource agents).
Run on-premises and Cloud-service providers (Azure, GCP, AWS).
Azure, AWS, and GCP automated adjustments for each provider best-practices.

sect1.title: High available NFS storage
sect1.para: Use the &salt; formulas drbd-formula and habootstrap-formula to create a highly available NFS storage cluster.
Use the formula drbd-formula for setting up and managing DRBD devices with the command drbdadm. Find more information in .
Use the &salt; formula habootstrap-formula for bootstrapping and managing a high availability cluster with the &crmshell;.
